bibl.title: Damascius and the Collectio philosophica. A Chapter in the History of Philosophical Schools and Libraries in the Neoplatonic Tradition.
What Happened to the Ancient Library of Alexandria?
bibl.author: LEROUX, Georges

bibl.note: Suggests that the Collectio philosophica in the Platonic tradition was assembled so that Damaseius could bring it from Alexandria to Athens in the late fifth century, from where it was at a later date brought to Constantinople.
LEROUX Georges, Damascius and the Collectio philosophica. A Chapter in the History of Philosophical Schools and Libraries in the Neoplatonic Tradition.
Mostafa EL-ABBADI and Omnia Mounir FATHALLAH (Edd.), What Happened to the Ancient Library of Alexandria? = Library of the Written Word. 3. The Manuscript World. 1 (Leiden - Boston, 2008) pp. 171-189.
